title: Average per game attendance English Premier League 2018/19
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average attendance, with a total of 10 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately positive which exists from 2013/14 to 2011/12.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2011/12 to 2009/10.
But, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2018/19 to 2017/18.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2017/18 to 2016/17.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2016/17 to 2015/16.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2015/16 to 2014/15.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014/15 to 2013/14.
gold: The statistic shows the average per game attendance at games of the English Premier League from the 2009/10 season to the 2018/19 season . In 2018/19 , the average attendance at the games was at 38,484 .
